intro: Haplophyllum hispanicum var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf haplophyllum, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native range.
